intro: Strychnos myrtoides, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red when mature. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
